Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Abstract class not being converted properly in android Native binding(.aar)" (#2613) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I have come across a problem while binding .AAR library in Xamarin.Android.
There is an abstract class in library which implements an interface.
Now the problem is, it seems it is not mandatory in java to implement members of interface in abstract class because it will be implemented in the class which implements that abstract class. Whereas in c#,it is mandatory for abstract class to implement members of an interface either abstractly or explicitly.

### Steps to Reproduce

```
public interface MyInterface 
{
void myMethod();
}
```
Java - 
```
public abstract class MyAbstractClass implements MyInterface
{
//not necessary to implement 'MyInterface' members here..
}
```

C# - 
```
public abstract class MyAbstractClass implements MyInterface
{
//Necessary to implement 'MyInterface' members here..
//public abstract void myMethod(); OR public void myMethod(){ };
}
```

### Expected Behavior
It should abstractly implement the methods of interface in abstract class while creating bindings in c#

### Actual Behavior
It gives error that MyAbstractClass does not implement interface members


**Please look into this and reply I have been stuck in it for days**

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] use System.Reflection.Metadata in <ResolveAssemblies/>" (#2612) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/tree/master/src/System.Reflection.Metadata/src/System/Reflection/Metadata
Context: https://github.com/jonathanpeppers/Benchmarks

There is a new System.Reflection.Metadata library from corefx for
reading .NET assemblies. It is a bit more performant than Mono.Cecil
because it is a different library with different opinions.

Some notes about System.Reflection.Metadata:

- SRM has a forward "reader" style API
- SRM uses lots of structs, and you have to do an additional call to
lookup strings generally.
- SRM, as far as I have seen, doesn't have APIs to modify and write
out new assemblies.
- SRM only supports "portable" pdb files.
- SRM is not well documented yet. To discover usage, I read source
  code and/or unit tests.

From my benchmark above, it seems that SRM is 10x faster on
Windows/.NET framework and 5x faster on macOS/Mono.

So it makes sense for use to use SRM when reading assemblies (and we
don't need symbols), and continue with Mono.Cecil for the linker and
other things that modify assemblies.

There are a few places we can take advantage of SRM, but the simplest
with a reasonable impact was `ResolveAssemblies`:

    Before:
    320 ms  ResolveAssemblies                          1 calls
    After:
    112 ms  ResolveAssemblies                          1 calls

So a ~200ms savings on this MSBuild task, which runs on *every* build.
This was the Xamarin.Forms test project in this repo: a build with no
changes.

## Changes ##

- Added a `MetadataResolver` type, as a way to cache `PEReader`
  instances. This is a comparable drop-in replacement for
  `DirectoryAssemblyResolver`.
- `MonoAndroidHelper.IsReferenceAssembly` now uses
  `System.Reflection.Metadata` instead of `Mono.Cecil`. This is used
  in a few other MSBuild tasks.
- A `MetadataExtensions` provides an extension method to simplify
  getting the full name of a custom attribute. We can add more here as
  needed.

The resulting code *should* be the same, except we are using SRM over
Mono.Cecil.

## Downstream ##

We will need to add the following assemblies to the installer:

- `System.Reflection.Metadata.dll`
- `System.Collections.Immutable.dll`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "UWP Windows 10.1809 RichTextBlock ContextFlyout failed" (#4975) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
RichTextBlock ContextFlyout no longer shown

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run BibleMoments app from Microsoft Store
2. On Windows 10.1803, double tap on any verse to select some text.  Then, long press displays Context Flyout.
3. On Windows 10.1809, double tap on any verse to select some text.  Then, long press **does not** display Context Flyout.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Android] Correctly dispose TabbedPageRenderer." (#4974) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
Fix the disposing of the TabbedPageRenderer.

There are several problems with the current implementation of the dispose :
- The fragments created by the FragmentPagerAdapter was not removed
- The TabSelected listeners are not correctly cleared
- The PageChange listeners are not cleared

### Issues Resolved ### 
- fixes #4973

### API Changes ###
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 
- Android

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 
Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###
- Install the repro App : [issue4973.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2752742/issue4973.zip)
- Go to the tab of the right
- Go to another tab

### PR Checklist ###
- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [X] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [X] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ListView Bindings fire multiple times on Android SDK 24+" (#2080) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Migrated from https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=60699

I am using Xamarin.Forms with a ListView with some bindings, targeting iOS and Android. When running the app on Android SDK 23, performance is good; however, starting on SDK 24 on physical devices (Nexus 5X is the model tested) I see some performance issues when scrolling the list. When using Visual Studio to debug, I see that the binding events are being fired haphazardly, sometimes firing twice in succession and sometimes for the all the items in the list – I have reproduced this with Xamarin.Forms 2.4.0.282. On iOS, the duplicate entries exist but only fire for the new elements being rendered.

Sample output (Android SDK 25):
```10/18/2017 1:57:01 PM [BindingFired] 10 item
10/18/2017 1:57:01 PM [BindingFired] This is an item description.
10/18/2017 1:57:01 PM [BindingFired] http://lorempixel.com/100/100/sports/
10/18/2017 1:57:01 PM [BindingFired] 11 item
10/18/2017 1:57:01 PM [BindingFired] This is an item description.
10/18/2017 1:57:03 PM [BindingFired] http://lorempixel.com/100/100/sports/
10/18/2017 1:57:03 PM [BindingFired] 5 item
10/18/2017 1:57:03 PM [BindingFired] This is an item description.
10/18/2017 1:57:04 PM [BindingFired] http://lorempixel.com/100/100/sports/
10/18/2017 1:57:04 PM [BindingFired] 6 item
10/18/2017 1:57:04 PM [BindingFired] This is an item description.
10/18/2017 1:57:05 PM [BindingFired] http://lorempixel.com/100/100/sports/
10/18/2017 1:57:05 PM [BindingFired] 12 item
10/18/2017 1:57:05 PM [BindingFired] This is an item description.
10/18/2017 1:57:05 PM [BindingFired] http://lorempixel.com/100/100/sports/
10/18/2017 1:57:05 PM [BindingFired] 12 item
10/18/2017 1:57:05 PM [BindingFired] This is an item description.
10/18/2017 1:57:05 PM [BindingFired] http://lorempixel.com/100/100/sports/
```
The ListView is defined as follows:
```<ListView x:Name="ItemsListView" ItemsSource="{Binding Items}" 
                VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand" HasUnevenRows="true" 
                RefreshCommand="{Binding LoadItemsCommand}" 
                IsPullToRefreshEnabled="true" IsRefreshing="{Binding IsBusy, Mode=OneWay}" 
                CachingStrategy="RecycleElement" ItemSelected="OnItemSelected">
```
On Android SDK 23 and below, the bindings are fired in order as they appear on the screen, never duplicate.

The performance problem is still apparent with HasUnevenRows disabled. I've captured profilers of both SDK23 and SDK25 where the issue can be seen, also updated the sample with both recommendations.

The real issue is the difference in performance between both SDKs - is there any difference in how the bindings are fired in each SDK that would explain the difference in performance?

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.4.0.282
- Last known good version: unknown
- IDE: Visual Studio
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - Android: 24+
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: Nexus 5X

### Reproduction Link

See Bugzilla ticket.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "HTML , CSS style with grid in android " (#3286) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
I have a string with HTML code that has CSS grid. In iOS, it works fine like my browser etc but in android, there is like can't understand the columns of the grid. I tried several code formats about a CSS grid nothing changed.
 
### Steps to Reproduce
I just load an HTML code with CSS grid into a webview. 
In the Reproduction Link its easy to see the issue.
### Expected Behavior
In the iOS screenshot it's the exptected behavior.
### Actual Behavior
Android screenshot. 
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.0.482510 & 3.1.0.583944 & 3.1.0.637273
- Last known good version:
- IDE:
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  11.4
  - Android: 5.0.2 & 6.0 

### Screenshots
Android(here is the issue):
The zero is NOT in the same row with the text.
![android](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5402512/42637382-b26da3b0-85f3-11e8-9c6f-635e288fcee3.png)

iOS(working fine):
![ios](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5402512/42637380-b1034e44-85f3-11e8-9dbb-ac2367b66091.png)

### Reproduction Link
https://github.com/stavrianos/XamarinWebView

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Foundation] Add a couple of missing NSDate properties and methods" (#5392) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened issue "[TrueDepthData]AVMediaType.DepthData variable is missing" (#5391) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Steps to Reproduce

1. Install Xamarin.iOS master, Version: 12.7.0.35 (Visual Studio Enterprise)
Hash: 327c0a8d
2. Check for AVMediaType.DepthData in class AVMediaType and it is missing. This is used in a sample [["StreamingDepthData"]](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/avfoundation/cameras_and_media_capture/streaming_depth_data_from_the_truedepth_camera)

> if let connection = depthDataOutput.connection(with: .depthData) {
    connection.isEnabled = true
} else {
    print("No AVCaptureConnection")
}

Apple Documentation: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/avfoundation/avmediatypedepthdata?language=objc

### Expected Behavior
NSString AVMediaType.DepthData should be available
### Actual Behavior
AVMediaType.DepthData is missing

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "AVCaptureSession not working on Xam.Mac" (#5390) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build and run attached test project on MacOS "avcapturesessiontest" on a computer that has a video source like a USB webcam or iSight cam.
2. The ViewController class then
2b. Asks permission to access camera and microphone for input.
2c. Creates and AVCaptureSession object
2d. Finds default video input and creates input device object
2e. Adds input device to AVCaptureSession
2f. Adds output for live preview to AVCaptureSession with sample buffer output delegate
2g. Creates AV PreviewLayer from AVCaptureSession
2h. Adds live preview layer as layer or sublayer of ViewController's NSView object.
2g. AVCaptureSession.StartRunning is called.
3. Nothing displays in preview layer, and no sample buffers are output even though current state of AVCaptureSession.Running is true.

### Expected Behavior
Upon application launch, live camera/video input should be displayed in View of ViewController.
Sample Buffer should be ouput to delegate with every frame of video input.

### Actual Behavior
Nothing displays in preview layer, and no sample buffers are output even though current state of AVCaptureSession.Running is true.

### Environment

<!--
1.
Visual Studio: Help > About Microsoft Visual Studio > Copy Info [button]
Visual Studio for Mac: Visual Studio > About Visual Studio > Show Details > Copy Information [button]
2. Paste into the code block below (between ```)
-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[CoreFoundation, ObjCRuntime] Add DispatchBlock APIs, in particular those that surface QOS" (#5389) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Closed issue "Latest version of Xamarin iOS crashing with UIKit.UIKitThreadAccessException" (#5386) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce


1. pull down Xamarin Forms repro with the iOS-create branch
   https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/tree/ios-recreate

2. run build.sh (this will open VS)
3. set Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.iOS to startup project
4. click "go to test cases"
5. now in the search bar type and delete things. If it doesn't crash then try clicking one of the bugs in the list then go back and typing again

![2019-01-11_13-07-26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5375137/51058653-b069f800-15a6-11e9-98ba-44a6873ec26c.gif)


### Expected Behavior
Shouldn't crash

### Actual Behavior
Crashes

### Environment

#### Version with Issue
```
=== Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 Preview for Mac ===

Version 8.0 Preview (8.0 build 1084)
Installation UUID: fae43bc3-a47b-4638-a8fc-dfb6d5bfc1f4
	GTK+ 2.24.23 (Raleigh theme)
	Xamarin.Mac 5.6.0.1 (d16-0 / 2e9867a4)

	Package version: 518000235

=== Mono Framework MDK ===

	Mono 5.18.0.235 (2018-08/25a8be91115) (64-bit)
	Package version: 518000235
